result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam James St Louis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam James St Louis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Adam James St Louis.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 22CF1825 for the purpose of sentencing.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Adam James St Louis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Adam James St Louis.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel requests an adjournment, due to reasons discussed off the record. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Adam James St Louis not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Defendant has a pending matter 22CF1825 in Branch 29 and defense counsel requests global transfer.  Court allows for transfer to Branch 29 for global resolution. If cases do not globally resolve, Court ordered case adjourned for status in Branch 37.
Case adjourned for status in Branch 29.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Adam James St Louis not in court, in custody.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Plummer has received discovery.  The defendant has a felony case that is about to be charged and Atty. Plummer requests a status conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 37.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 05-11-2022, filed.  rmm
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Adam James St Louis in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Adam James St Louis in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
